doc.title: Great Wall Q2:WEY to go - Better near-term prospects
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Great Wall Q2 WEY to go Better near-term prospectsGreat Wall Q2 WEY to go Better near-term prospects_2025-08-31

passages.text: **Great Wall Motor Co Ltd**

**Q2 results in line with preliminary numbers.** Great Wall reported Q2 revenue of RMB 52.3bn,+7.7% yoy and +30.7% qoq, driven by robust sales volume momentum (+10.1%yoy and +21.9% qoq) on accelerated product launches. ASP is estimated to be RMB 167k for the quarter (-2.1% yoy and +7.3% qoq), as Tank and WEY brands mix reached 26%(vs. 27% in Q2 24 and 22% in Q1 25). Great Wall recorded 18.8% gross margin in Q2 25,-165bps lower vs. Q2 24 and +96bps vs. Q1 25, primarily due to lower mix of Tank and Pick-up compared to prior year, and lower overseas margin (i.e. Russia saw c.3-4% margin erosion from scrappage tax policy). Operating profit reached RMB 5.1bn with 9.8% margin in Q2 25, vs. 9.2% in Q2 24 and 4.3% in Q1 25 driven by increased government subsidies in the quarter. Stripping out the RMB 2.2bn of government grants, operating margin would have been 5.5% for Q2 25. Net income was RMB 4.6bn, +19.4% yoy and +161.9% qoq, implying 8.8% margin, or 4.5% excluding government grant, vs. 7.9% in Q2 24 and 4.4% in Q1 25.

**New product cycle gaining WEY better traction.** Great Wall's recent product launches,including Tank 500, WEY Gaoshan and Haval Dagou, has all garnered strong orders. The streak of success showcased the company's enhanced product competitiveness and D2C sales strategy. The company is confidently targeting 40%+ HoH growth in H2, which we think is achievable based on recent traction. We are particularly impressed by the performance of WEY, which reached over 10k monthly deliveries in June and July, driven by the Gaoshan and Lanshan PHEVs. We lifted our FY 2025 volume forecast to 1.35mn (old:1.29mn), +9.4% yoy growth.

**Great Wall Market-Perform** with TP of **HK$16.50** (old: HK$13.50), based on 1-year forward 9x P/E multiple (old: 8x). We lifted our earnings estimates and valuation multiple on the back of stronger product cycle and improved earnings visibility.

While the company's near-term prospects are expected to benefit from this enhanced product generation, we remain cautious about its mid- to long-term outlook. Limited visibility persists due to the company's relatively slow progress in BEV development to date.Consequently, we maintain our Market-Perform rating for the time being.

Prioritizing LATAM for next leg of overseas growth. With prospects in Russia becoming less favorable, the focus has shifted to other markets. In LATAM, following the recent opening of the Brazil plant, the company aims to expand its product portfolio in the region. Additionally, there are plans to launch a compact BEV sedan for the European market in late 2025 or early 2026. We also note that the company's TANK is gaining popularity in overseas markets such as ASEAN, bringing incremental growth as momentum in the domestic market moderates. However, concerns remain regarding the drag from the Russian market, which currently accounts for approximately \(40\%\) of Great Wall's overseas revenue mix.

We raise our revenue estimates by \(+8\% / + 3\%\) for 2025/2026, respectively, on the back of strong product cycle. Major launches are planned across brands in Q4 throughout next year, especially in Q4 with key models like Gaoshan 7 and Tank 400/700. Our earnings forecast for 2025/2026 is revised up by \(+14\% / + 11\%\) respectively, as a result. Exhibit 14 shows a summary of our estimate changes. Our latest projections for the company are attached in the appendix section. We remain Market Perform rating on Great Wall. We raise our PT to \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 16.50\) (Old: \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 13.50\) ) on higher earnings estimates and 9x1- year forward P/E (Old: 8x), reflecting improved product cycle and earnings visibility.

EXHIBIT 9: East and Central Europe (mainly Russia), Middle East & Africa, and Oceania and South America are the top export destinations of Great Wall, claiming 50%, 13%, and 13% export volume respectively in the quarter; the Russian market mix increased to 44% from 39%
Great Wall: Overseas sales mix by destination
Source: IHS and Bernstein analysis
EXHIBIT 10: Selling expenses arrived at RMB 2.7bn in Q2 2025 (+64.8% yoy and +19.4% qoq), which implied 5.2% of total revenue vs. 3.4% in Q2 2024 and 5.7% in Q1 2025
EXHIBIT 11: Administrative expenses were RMB 3.3bn in Q2 2025 (+1.6% yoy and +15.6% qoq), which implied 6.3% of revenue; vs. 6.7% in Q2 2024 and 7.1% in Q1 2025

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, L.P. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.
We value Great Wall based on one/two year forward P/E multiples.
We value Great Wall on 9x 2026E P/Emultiple and arrive at a price target of HK\$16.50.

The downside risks to Great Wall mainly relate to slower than expected industry sales growth, weaker demand from overseas markets, execution on new product launches in its EV brands such as WEY and Ora.
The upside risk to Great Wall relates to faster than expected overseas expansion and successful launch of BEV products.

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp- Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-15 pp- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI) index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non- Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:

Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp- Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within \(+ / - 10\) pp- Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12- month time horizon.
